annotation.name: def_struct_names.navi2NNG_DisplayedTime_t
annotation.value: year, month, day, hour, minute, second

annotation.name: def_struct_types.navi2NNG_DisplayedTime_t
annotation.value: n, y, y, y, y, y

annotation.name: def_struct_names.navi2NNG_JpjHypothesis_t
annotation.value: level1_id, level2_id, level3_id, level4_id, level5_id, level6_id

annotation.name: def_struct_types.navi2NNG_JpjHypothesis_t
annotation.value: u, u, u, u, u, u

doc.line: The Nuance LLC code of the VR (VDE) language currently in use.
This method is used to retrieve the VR language currently used by the OS.
The LCID of the TTS language currently in use.
This method returns the LCID of the current TTS language in the OS
language = the Microsoft LCID of the language that should be used by the navigation engine
GetLanguage = This method returns the system language to EmNavi.
The unique VIN of the car
Returns the Vehicle Identification Number of the vehicle as a string.
Returns the region and branding information of the vehicle.
This function returns the unit in which the temperature should be displayed.
GetDayNightMode = This method returns the day/night mode to EmNavi.
GetTimeFormat = This method returns the time format to EmNavi.
GetLengthUnit = This method returns the length unit to EmNavi.
This method tells whether the phone is connected

FuelType = enum( Fuel_Unknown (0), Fuel_Gasoline_DISI (1), Fuel_Gasoline_EFI (2), Fuel_Diesel_DI (3), Fuel_Diesel_IDI (4), Fuel_EV_HEV (5), Fuel_NaturalGas_CFI (6), Fuel_NaturealGas_EFI (7), Fuel_FlexibleFuel_CFI (8), Fuel_FlexibleFuel_EFI (9), Fuel_Gasoline_iStop (10), Fuel_Diesel_iStop (11) )
This method returns the type of fuel used in the car.
This method tells whether network is available .
List of layouts. All ids must come from the set defined in the method KeyboardLayout in this file.
Returns the list of the keyboard layouts available at JCI side
KeyboardLayout is one of the following values
This method tells the currently selected keyboard layout.
Number of keyboards at the top that needs to be marked as recent
This method returns the state of a speed restriction being active or not.
Returns the localized text for "Recent" word
GetVolumeRequestEnabled = This method returns whether it is allowed for the navi engine to request change of the volume.
Volume strength: falls between 0 and 63 inclusively, 0 means the guidance is muted.
"This method returns the volume with which JCI plays navigation-related sounds."
phoneNumber = the string for the phone number to call
name = the string name for the contact (POI name)
This method triggers the phone application with the phone number to call and the name string.
TimeStamp: The value of the monotonic system clock (millisecond precision) when the reply to GetTimeMode was sent out. Will be ignored on the receiving side if Mode is TIME_AUTO.

DispayedTime: The time that should be displayed (according to the user) when the reply to GetTimeMode was sent out. The first unsigned 16-bit value represents the year, then the following five bytes correspond to the month, day, hour, minute and second respectively. It will be ignored on the receiving side if Mode is TIME_AUTO.
This method is used to notify a running NNG system that the user changed the time mode (or the displayed time)
ShutdownRequest = This signal instructs the navigation engine to close. Note that the engine will only receive this message between its DBusClientStarted and DBusClientStopped signals.
This signal instructs the navigation engine to delete the save folder and restart.
ShowNavigation = This signal informs the navigation engine that it is about to get the focus and should start rendering.
With this signal, JCI acknowledges that it has received NNG's RequestShowNavigation signal, but it cannot yield the focus.
This signal should be issued by JCI whenever the user presses the home button
This signal is issued by JCI if it detects a long press of the favorite button
This signal is issued by JCI if it detects that the navi button has been pressed.
GuiFocusStatusUpdate = This signal returns the updates for the GUI focus status of the EmNavi app.
The id of the audio effect in question.
This signal informs the navigation engine about a fate of a given audio effect or voice.
Volume strength: falls between 0 and 63 inclusively, 0 means the guidance is muted.
"This signal informs NNG that guidance volume has been changed"
A string identifying the event, e.g., "NavigateToARecentDestination"
This signal tells NNG that a VUI event occurred.
This should fall between 1 and 5 inclusively, depending on whether the user say "Line 1", "Line 2", etc.
This signal tells NNG that the user selected a given line on the list.
The hypothesized category list, e.g., ("POI_HOSPITAL", "POI_DENTIST"). These strings should constitute a subset of the list that was passed by NNG signal POICategoryList.
This signal tells NNG that the user said something like: Navigate to the nearest hospital, or Navigate to the nearest dentist.
The hypothesized category list, e.g., ("hospital", "dentist"). These strings should constitute a subset of the list that was passed by NNG signal POICategoryList.
This signal tells NNG that the user said something like: Add waypoint, hospital, or Add waypoint, dentist.
A structure of integers describing the Japanese hypothesis.
It contains the IDs for the partially recognized utterance.
The IDs which are not valid will be filled with 9999999.
Japanese one shot destination search result
Array of structures of integers describing the Japanese hypothesis list. The first integer is the array length
It contains the IDs for the partially recognized utterance.
The IDs which are not valid will be filled with 9999999.
Array of structures of integers describing the hypothesis list. The first integer is the array length
First unsigned integer: The state id recognized, or 0, if not applicable (e.g., in France)
Second unsigned integer: The city id recognized.
Third unsigned integer: The street id recognized.
Fourth unsigned integer: The house number recognized.
Array of integers describing the hypothesis list, interpeted as ids. The first integer is the array length
General hypothesis list for structured VDE
This parameter shows which mode was the source of last UI event if any
VUI (0x0) - Context was triggered by VUI
GUI (0x1) - Context was triggered by GUI
This signal is issued whenever the modality of the VR should be changed. NNG will use this in SetContext
unless it has more up-to-date information available about what parameter to use.
Requests NNG to send the GuidanceChanged signal
State of the address (in the case of US).
Street name and house number of the address.
This signal requests the NAVI engine to navigate to an address.
The unique id of the favorite
Delete a favourite stored by NNG
Delete all the favorites. (This does not affect the home favorite.)
The unique id of the favorite to navigate to
The unique id of the favorite whose name is to be changed
Change the name of a favourite stored by NNG
Request the focus and provide the user a way to set the home position.
Delete the information associated with the home favorite.
The unique id of the first favorite
The unique id of the second favorite
Change the order of the two favorites
The unique id of the favorite to move
The unique id of the favorite after which the favorite corresponding to ID1 should be inserted.
Move a favorite to the position following another favorite
Save the current position among the favorites with an empty name.
The id of the favorite that should be replaced
The contents of the given favorite should be discarded, and replaced by the current position.
Save the current destination among the favorites with an empty name.
The id of the favorite that should be replaced.
The contents of the given favorite should be discarded, and replaced by the current destination.
State of the address (in the case of US).
Street name and house number of the address.
This signal requests the NNG engine to add the address and the name to the favorite list.
The id of the favorite that should be replaced.
State of the address (in the case of US).
Street name and house number of the address.
This signal requests the NNG engine to add the address and the name to the favorite list in place of another favorite
